slides.title: Cost Behavior
slides.content:
# Cost Patterns

## Cost Types

| Type | Behavior |
|------|----------|
| Fixed | Constant total |
| Variable | Constant per unit |
| Mixed | Both components |
| Step | Fixed within range |

## High-Low Method

```
Variable cost = (High cost - Low cost) / (High activity - Low activity)

Fixed cost = Total cost - (Variable x Activity)
```

## Relevant Range

Assumptions hold within specific volume.

## Cost Estimation

- Account analysis
- Engineering method
- Regression analysis

slides.title: CVP Analysis
slides.content:
# Cost-Volume-Profit

## Break-Even Point

```
BEP (units) = Fixed Costs / Contribution per unit

BEP (sales) = Fixed Costs / CM Ratio
```

## Contribution Margin

```
CM per unit = Selling Price - Variable Cost

CM Ratio = CM / Sales
```

## Target Profit

```
Units = (Fixed Costs + Target Profit) / CM per unit
```

## Margin of Safety

```
MoS = Actual Sales - Break-Even Sales

MoS% = MoS / Actual Sales
```

slides.title: Profitability Analysis
slides.content:
# Segment Profitability

## Segment Margin

```
Sales
- Variable costs
= Contribution margin
- Direct fixed costs
= Segment margin
- Common fixed costs
= Operating income
```

## Traceable vs Common

| Traceable | Common |
|-----------|--------|
| Directly attributable | Shared |
| Segment responsibility | Cannot assign |

## Customer Profitability

| Factor | Impact |
|--------|--------|
| Volume | Revenue |
| Returns | Costs |
| Service | Support |
| Payment | Collection |

slides.title: Investment Center Metrics
slides.content:
# Investment Performance

## Return on Investment

```
ROI = Operating Income / Average Assets

or

ROI = Margin x Turnover
    = (Income/Sales) x (Sales/Assets)
```

## Residual Income

```
RI = Operating Income - (Assets x Required Return)
```

## ROI vs RI

| ROI | RI |
|-----|----|
| Percentage | Dollar amount |
| May reject good projects | Better decisions |
| Comparison easy | Size matters |

## Economic Value Added

```
EVA = NOPAT - (Capital x WACC)
```

slides.title: Benchmarking
slides.content:
# Performance Comparison

## Types of Benchmarking

| Type | Comparison |
|------|------------|
| Internal | Own divisions |
| Competitive | Direct competitors |
| Functional | Same function |
| Generic | Best practices |

## Process

```
1. Identify what to benchmark
2. Select comparators
3. Collect data
4. Analyze gaps
5. Implement improvements
```

## Benefits

- Identify best practices
- Set realistic targets
- Drive improvement

slides.title: Quality Management

| Category | Examples |
|----------|----------|
| Prevention | Training, design |
| Appraisal | Inspection, testing |

| External failure | Warranty, returns |

## Trade-offs

```
More prevention/appraisal

```

## TQM

Total Quality Management:
- Customer focus
- Continuous improvement
- Employee involvement

## Six Sigma

- DMAIC process
- Statistical quality
- 3.4 defects per million

slides.title: Operating Leverage
slides.content:
# Leverage Effect

## Degree of Operating Leverage

```
DOL = Contribution Margin / Operating Income

or

DOL = % Change in Operating Income / % Change in Sales
```

## Interpretation

| High DOL | Low DOL |
|----------|--------|
| More fixed costs | More variable costs |
| Higher risk | Lower risk |
| Larger profit swings | Smaller swings |

## Example

```
DOL of 3 means:
10% increase in sales
= 30% increase in profit
```

slides.title: Capacity Analysis
slides.content:
# Capacity Utilization

## Capacity Types

| Type | Definition |
|------|------------|
| Theoretical | Maximum possible |
| Practical | Normal adjustments |
| Normal | Average expected |
| Budgeted | Planned level |

## Idle Capacity

```
Capacity available - Capacity used
= Idle capacity

Idle capacity x Cost per unit
= Cost of idle capacity
```

## Capacity Decisions

- Expand or contract
- Outsource
- Special orders
